Caption: Figure 5. Fixations (marked as white circles) made (on the left) by a viewer following instructions to “identify important content in the photo,” and (on the right) by another viewer instructed to insert and adjust the contrast of a photo. Fixated locations are similar.
Mention:
tion and adjustment task is shown in Figure 5. This exper-
iment is not a full evaluation of gaze-based interaction for
cropping under field conditions. However, it does suggest
that real tasks involving images are functionally similar to
our artificial task of identifying important content. We leave
deeper investigation of this issue as future work.
